channel.title: Posts on Hunger United

item.title: Comal Crackers
item.description: Comal Crackers Comal is type of griddle/ round flat pan to heat up / cook certain types of things over a stove instead of oven. Originally I was making coconut crepes and another gluten free vegan crepe batter that is from my upbringing, then it lead to me experimenting to see what I can do with the batter instead of using loads more oil ( i was able to use a stainless steel pot to prepare the crÃªpes instead of a nonstick pan using a method with oil to make a stainless steel pot nonstick,that led to the crepes frying instead of cooking the way its supposed to, but it was crispy and yummy like I like it but too oily for me.

item.title: Sourdough Starters and How to Control Sourness
item.description: How to make your own sourdough starter, and how to control the sourness of your starter.

item.title: Fermented Carrots and/or Beets
item.description: Fermented Carrots and/or Beets Recipe makes one jar of fermented vegetable of your choice SUPPLIES: One 24-32 fl oz Mason jars that have screw on lids, or reuse any clean & sanitized glass jars that used to contain pasta sauce, pickles, etc. Thin cotton towel or cheese cloth and a rubber band, if using a mason jar with screw on lids. 3 medium carrots or 5 small beets (organic whenever possible).
